intro: Lasianthus formosensis, commonly known as the Formosan lasianthus, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
